meanings.sent1: In Lesotho, you can use maloti to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for maloti at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted maloti, no other currency.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as valuable as a stack of maloti.
meanings.sent5: The shiny maloti coins jingled in his pocket.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Lesotho, equal to 100 lisente.
meanings.sent1: I need to save up a lot of lisente to exchange for maloti.
meanings.sent2: She received her salary in maloti and lisente.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was filled with shiny maloti and lisente.
meanings.sent4: His savings grew like a pile of maloti and lisente.
meanings.sent5: The market bustled with vendors trading in maloti and lisente.
